title: Green and Gold Dance Performance Makeup!
description: Connor danced her little heart out at a performance recently! They did a tap routine wearing the cutest green and gold costumes. Her dance team requires the girls to wear red lipstick for performances, and the rest of the makeup is up to the individual dancer. Usually Connor only likes to wear MAC Fashion Legacy lipstick, and maybe if I’m lucky, she’ll let me swipe a little pink blush on her cheeks (NARS Gaiety is her go-to shade). She usually skips eye makeup. I KNOW! Anywho, I was absolutely shocked when at the last minute she asked me to put on some eyeshadow. We had about five minutes left to get ready when she made this request, but of course I responded with an enthusiastic yes! I dug through a drawer and found a palette of brights from Nomad Cosmetics. First I swiped on the green shade with a finger, then buffed out the edges with a fluffy eyeshadow brush. I layered the gold shade on top and blended the two together! siteName: Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup
text: Connor danced her little heart out at a performance recently! They did a tap routine wearing the cutest green and gold costumes. Her dance team requires the girls to wear red lipstick for performances, and the rest of the makeup is up to the individual dancer. Usually Connor only likes to wear MAC Fashion Legacy lipstick, and maybe if I’m lucky, she’ll let me swipe a little pink blush on her cheeks (NARS Gaiety is her go-to shade). She usually skips eye makeup. I KNOW! Anywho, I was absolutely shocked when at the last minute she asked me to put on some eyeshadow. We had about five minutes left to get ready when she made this request, but of course I responded with an enthusiastic yes! I dug through a drawer and found a palette of brights from Nomad Cosmetics. First I swiped on the green shade with a finger, then buffed out the edges with a fluffy eyeshadow brush. I layered the gold shade on top and blended the two together! Sure, I wish I had a little more time to clean up some edges, but for five minutes, I think we did ok. Proof of mom! How’s your Saturday going so far? It’s crazy windy and rainy here in Northern California! Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen Reader Interactions
html:
Connor danced her little heart out at a performance recently! They did a tap routine wearing the cutest green and gold costumes.

Her dance team requires the girls to wear red lipstick for performances, and the rest of the makeup is up to the individual dancer. Usually Connor only likes to wear MAC Fashion Legacy lipstick, and maybe if I’m lucky, she’ll let me swipe a little pink blush on her cheeks (NARS Gaiety is her go-to shade). She usually skips eye makeup. I KNOW!

Anywho, I was absolutely shocked when at the last minute she asked me to put on some eyeshadow. We had about five minutes left to get ready when she made this request, but of course I responded with an enthusiastic yes!

I dug through a drawer and found a palette of brights from Nomad Cosmetics.

First I swiped on the green shade with a finger, then buffed out the edges with a fluffy eyeshadow brush. I layered the gold shade on top and blended the two together!

Sure, I wish I had a little more time to clean up some edges, but for five minutes, I think we did ok.

How’s your Saturday going so far? It’s crazy windy and rainy here in Northern California!

Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict,

Karen
